Why Nietzsche in nhentai comments

@legsandthighs Part 3. Nietzsche specified these type of people in what he called Master/slave morality. I'd highly recommend you do some reading, and on the highly criticized (Obviously, ever since the Enlightenment the West has been a mess) book called Might is Right by Ragnar Redbeard, the name is pseudonymous and some have said it might have been Nietzsche who wrote it in secret or Arthur Desmond himself. I also recommend you read Industrial Society and Its Future for a similar analysis into this pathology.

@legsandthighs  Part 2. I will however say, that the main protagonist of these NTR always lack initiative, aggression, masculinity, a type of gullible attitude that is easily exploited, they lack what Carl Jung called a Shadow. That is the component that they are missing. Obviously the reader will fall into two categories and  the feeling that arises are born out of behaviors depending on the society and family you were raised in. If you were raised by a single mother, or a society that smothered your masculinity like first world countries due to obvious reasons, then I'm sure one would feel emotional, hate and at the same time turn on because in their subconscious they have some sort of guilt or complex that they know they can't measure up. Basically low self-esteem. The other side will identify with the man doing the cucking since they see themselves are the masculine aggressor that takes what the wants and thinks nothing else, he is the conqueror.

@legsandthighs
Legs, those are some interesting thoughts and many of them I agree with. I also had a theory similar to yours which leads me to believe that most people are getting close to finally dissect the psychology behind these types of fetishes. The obvious instant is clearly masculinity, even with NTR that features ugly bastards they portray an air of masculinity that the main protagonist that is being cheated on lacks. I came to an interesting theory as to why most men in the first world are the way they are, and it also appears that even though outsiders of a different race come to the first world they sooner or later exhibit the same pattern of behavior. This behavior I have long theorized comes from a reaction to the Enlightenment, which was Rousseau's Romanticism. But upon further analysis and learning more about the tenant of Romanticism, it falls short.

I don't know why I like this one so much. She's not necessarily cheating or trying to be a shitty person, she's just hooking up. This isn't morally wrong, and she's under no obligation to stay loyal to someone she's not in a relationship with. There's an argument that the younger guy character is being fucked over because he likes her and is waiting out on the potential of MAYBE a relationship working between them, but this is a classic example of being over-invested in someone else when they shouldn't be. The innocence of being a high schooler drives it home because it is very relatable to a first love that did not work out; he's holding out and staying invested and committed to her when they haven't even kissed...

The fact that he was a shota and it was only love from his side leads me to believe in my head that he isnt losing much because of this as he's still a kid. The premise was interesting but it didn't go any further. Maybe an aspect of improvement would be the number of pages because I'm not sure as to whether that is the only thing limiting the story or whether it's our cuck, or cucker, our tomboy, or the characterisation in general. Anyway... couldn't fap, hope the direction improves because at its current state it has a lot to improve on.
